en_US.A 20 metros de profundidade está o: At 20 meters deep you will find the
en_US.A Corollarium é uma empresa que sempre d:
Corollarium is a company that has always developed technology and worked with visualization and virtual reality.
The idea of uniting diving, technology, and the environment into one Corollarium project was an old one. Finally the idea of applying technology to Laje de Santos emerged: "What if we were to transform an unusual experience, that of going to a beautiful but distant place, into something that was more open to the world?"
"What if we complemented the visit with information and technology?"
We could finally bring Corollarium's experience to this, with the support of ProAC, a project from the Government of the State of São Paulo.
en_US.A embarcação Moreia é naufragada. É o pr: The Moreia is a shipwrecked vessel. It is the first induced shipwreck made for diving in Brazil.
en_US.A Laje de Santos é rica em vida. 196 esp:
Laje de Santos is full of life. So far, 196 species of fish and 29 species of birds have been catalogued.
It is also inhabited by corals, algae, and other life forms. There are many areas with brown and red algae.

Laje de Santos is full of life. So far, 196 species of fish and 29 species of birds have been catalogued.
It is inhabited by corals, dolphins, turtles, algae, and manta rays.
en_US.A laje de Santos é um local de grande in: Laje de Santos is a place on the coast of São Paulo of great interest for the conservation of biological diversity, be it marine, terrestrial, or aerial. Five species of island seabirds nest at Laje: the Kelp gull, Larus dominicanus; three species of Terns, Sterna hirundinacea, S. eurygnatha, and S. maxima, which form colonies during the winter, and the Brown booby, Sula leucogaster, which nests year-round. Twenty-nine bird species have already been cataloged in Laje.
en_US.A Laje de Santos é um local popular para:
Laje de Santos is a popular diving spot. Close to the city of São Paulo, 1h30m by boat from the coast, and with a diversity of species that few places can match, usually within less than 10 meters of visibility. 
Please select a location for more information.
en_US.A Laje de Santos em Realidade Virtual: Laje de Santos in Virtual Reality
en_US.A Laje oferece condições muito especiais: Laje offers very special conditions in terms of diving depth and visibility. Along with the preservation and variety of life, this makes Laje one of the country's main spots for diving and underwater photography.
en_US.A raia-borboleta pode ser encontrada em: Butterfly rays can be found throughout the Atlantic Ocean, Black Sea, and Madeira and Canary Islands. They can be seen from 5 to 100 meters deep and, at Laje de Santos, they are seen during the spring and summer, using the region to rest during their reproductive period.
The queen of Laje de Santos.
en_US.A tecnologia para gerar as áreas de real:
The technology to generate the virtual reality areas includes several processes and knowledge.
For Laje's models, both above and underwater, we use software-processed reference photos. 
Many items were modeled by hand, such as fish and birds, so they could present quality and animation but still be light enough for the web.
en_US.Agradecemos às seguintes pessoas e insti: We thank the following people and institutions for their invaluable help in this project.
en_US.Além dos outros pontos citados, o PELMS: In addition to the previously mentioned points, the PELMS is known to be on the Manta rays' migratory route. It's one of the biggest fish in the world, reaching up to eight meters in wingspan and weighing more than two tons.
en_US.Ao encontrar uma moréia você perceberá s: When you encounter a Moray eel, you will notice its jaw in a constant opening and closing movement. It can look pretty scary, but it only means it's breathing, inhaling water that passes through it gills, exchanging the oxygen it needs.
en_US.As barracudas são peixes grandes de corp: Barracudas are large fish with an elongated body and a tapered missile-shaped head. They are very fast in the water as they are voracious predators with very sharp pointed teeth. The slightest contact with a barracuda can cause you serious injury. But they don't attack just like that! The important thing to do when diving or doing any activities in their habitat is not to bear any shiny accessories such as earrings, bracelets, or rings, as these objects attract their attention, confusing them into thinking that you are a potential prey, and thus speeding towards you, causing a heck of a scare in the unsuspecting diver.
en_US.As barracudas são peixes tão famosos que: Barracudas are so famous that even less experienced divers have heard of it and are afraid of crossing its path. Its fame is that of an evil, ferocious fish that can attack you at any time. And in all honesty, it really does live up to its fame due to cases of accidents with human beings in almost all parts of the world.
en_US.As raias-prego, ou raias manteiga como s: The Stingrays or Butterfly rays, as they are known to divers, always draw a crowd when found. They are flat-bodied animals associated with the substrate or sand bottom; they usually stop and deposit sand on top of their body to camouflage themselves so they can rest.
en_US.Ave de pequeno porte, de plumagem branca: Small bird, white plumage, with red beak and legs. It is considered a migratory bird, hailing from Argentina to nest in Brazil from April to September. They are excellent fishermen, feeding on small fish and crustaceans. They often hover in the air before diving to capture their prey.
en_US.busca a ampliação do conhecimento visand:
seeks knowledge expansion aiming at the preservation of the largest species of ray fish in the world, especially the ones proven to come from Brazil. In 2011 both species of Manta rays were recategorized, moving from the “NEAR THREATENED” stage to the more worrying “VULNERABLE” stage on the IUCN Red List.
It is suspected that Brazil holds the smallest population of Manta rays in the world, with an estimated population of only a few hundred.
en_US.Clique em um ponto de mergulho para ter: Click on a dive spot for more information.
en_US.Com a melhora da situação em 2021, pudem: With a more favorable situation in 2021, we were finally able to get ourselves wet.
en_US.Com comportamento semelhantes aos das ou: With a behavior similar to that of other species of Moray eels, the Golden Banana Moray is the rarest of them. Precisely because of its color, it stands out from other animals and is easily seen by predators. That's why it remains for a prolonged period in its lair and ventures out only to hunt. Whenever coming across one of them, you should feel privileged, savor the moment and take beautiful pictures.
en_US.Com uma população de apenas 30 indivíduo: With a population of just 30 individuals in Laje de Santos, they share the same space with brown boobies, band terns, royal terns, and frigate birds. Laje de Santos, as it is a protected conservation unit, disembarkation is not allowed unless in an emergency or for researchers. Climbing the rocks of Laje scares away birds of other species that reside there, and the seagulls, as they are opportunistic and stealthy, attack the unprotected nests to feed on the eggs and even newborn chicks.
en_US.Como a maioria das raias, elas também po: Like most rays, they also have the behavior of camouflaging themselves on the sand bottom, covering their entire body with a thin layer of sediment to protect themselves from possible predators. Every year we spot them, and generally, the females are pregnant, which you can tell from their prominent back.
en_US.Como são animais de vida longa, atingind: As they are long-lived animals, reaching sexual maturity after 30 years of age, the turtles found in Laje de Santos are juvenile animals using the area for food and shelter.
en_US.Conhecida no nordeste como Mututuca e no: Known in the northeast as "Mututuca" and in the southeast as "Miriquitis", the Myrichthys ocellatus "Goldspotted eel" is even more similar to the sea serpent. But it is not! It is a fish or sea eel, with a light coloration and rounded dark spots.
en_US.Coordenador do projeto, é engenheiro elé: Project coordinator, an electrical engineer and diver.
The Mantas do Brasil "Mantas of Brazil" project was created.
en_US.criado para ajudar na preservação das es: created to help preserve marine species on the São Paulo and Brazilian coast.
en_US.Dizem que as raias e os tubarões não pod: They say that rays and sharks can't stop swimming because they could drown, but not everything that you hear is true. In the case of some species of rays, when they are stationary, they open and close the operculum, sucking the water that passes through their gills (organ responsible for breathing), exchanging oxygen. Because of this behavior of burying itself in the sand and often remaining in shallow waters, some accidents with the sting in its tail are reported around the world. Its stinger is not poisonous, but it does contain many bacteria that can cause infections and aggravate the wound. One of the best known cases of attacks with this species was the case of zoologist and TV presenter Steve Irwin, known worldwide as the Crocodile Hunter, who died from an accidental sting of a ray of the Dasyatis genus.
en_US.Duas espécies de golfinhos habitam a Laj: Two species of dolphins inhabit Laje de Santos. It is common to see them during the boat crossing, appearing in small groups, accompanying the boat for a few minutes and again disappear into the open sea, seeming to welcome us.
en_US.Durante as suas migrações, as jamantas e: During their migrations, giant oceanic Manta rays frequently dive to depths of almost two kilometers (among the greatest ever measured for a marine animal), where water temperatures reach three degrees centigrade.
en_US.É conhecida popularmente como moréia pin: It is popularly known as painted moray due to the light and dark spots on their body with a marbled pattern. Despite looking like snakes or eels, morays are fish with a different anatomical shape.
en_US.É o primeiro naufrágio artificial do Bra: It is the first induced shipwreck made for diving in Brazil.
en_US.É permitido visitar com embarcações part: Visits with private vessels are permitted, following the navigation rules and with an accredited Master Pilot. Another option to visit the Laje is through an accredited tour and diving operators. Be sure to contact your dive center.
en_US.Encontrada em quase todos os oceanos, m: Found in almost all oceans, but at Laje de Santos they can be seen almost all year round, where its kind are even recognized by divers, thanks to the unique pattern of spots on its dorsal region. They are long-lived animals, reaching up to 18 years of age, and are often seen swimming alone or even in schools of more than 20, and often jumping out of the water. They feed on small crustaceans and bivalve molluscs (two-shell animals) having an extremely strong jaw, capable of crushing shells and carapaces.
en_US.Espalhadas às vezes longe demais para po: Spread, sometimes, too far to let us visit them. So far.
en_US.Espécies aviáticas e aquáticas da Laje d: Aerial and aquatic species of Laje de Santos
en_US.Esta espécie foi descrita já por Linnaeu: This species was already described by Linnaeus, in 1758. They are reef fishes from tropical seas that can be found throughout the Gulf of Mexico, the Caribbean, and the Brazilian coast, with very vibrant colors.
en_US.Esta espécie habita fundos marinhos roch: This species inhabits rocky and coralline seabeds with a depth of up to 300 meters. Groupers are distributed throughout the Atlantic Ocean in tropical, subtropical, and temperate zones, are extremely territorial and large predators, feeding on other fish and crustaceans. A fun fact about the grouper: this species is born female and after a few years becomes male, presenting hermaphroditism!
en_US.Esta espécie, conhecida popularmente com: This species, popularly known as parrotfish, is endemic to Brazil, being found only in Brazilian waters. They are colorful fish that live in reef environments up to 30 meters deep.
en_US.Este peixe é o arquiteto do mar. Habita: This fish is the architect of the sea. It lives at a depth that varies from 10 to 150 meters deep, on a sandy or limestone bottom, carefully builds its own house with pieces of coral skeletons, shells, and stones, carrying them on its mouth and piling one on top of the other, forming mounds up to 1 meter high and 1.5 meters wide. And so, he lives his whole life dedicating himself to the care of the house.
en_US.Este projeto buscou dados sobre a Laje d: This project looked for data on Laje de Santos in all possible ways. From open sources such as Wikimedia Commons, to institutions such as Instituto Laje Viva and Internet divers who kindly shared their photos. But more than that, we need to go to Laje de Santos to take specific photos and videos for this project with experienced divers.
en_US.Este projeto usa a realidade virtual par: This project uses virtual reality to generate a 3D model of the Parque Estadual Marinho da Laje de Santos "Laje de Santos Marine State Park", including submerged parts, allowing people from all over Brazil and the world to visit the park virtually, make simulated virtual dives, learn about the fauna that inhabits or migrates through the park and over the marine environment.
en_US.Este site usa as tecnologias mais atuais: This site uses the latest internet technologies to be interactive, immersive, and accessible. From cell phones to giant screens.
en_US.Existem duas espécies de tartarugas que: There are two species of turtles that inhabit Laje de Santos, the Green Turtle and the Hawksbill Turtle. They are similar, but some details are important to differentiate them: in the case of the Hawksbill turtle, they have a thinner and longer head, a falcon-like beak, roof-tile like overlapping or imbricated shell plates, yellowish brown color, and a well ornate shell. Green turtles, on the other hand, have the most symmetrical shell, with plates interspersed and connected like a puzzle, rounded head and predominant shell coloration from green and brown to light yellow on their belly.
en_US.Foram já identificadas 196 espécies de p: One hundred ninety-six species of fish have already been identified in Laje de Santos.
en_US.Fotos tiradas no Parque Estadual Marinho: Photos taken at Parque Estadual Marinho da Laje de Santos "Laje de Santos Marine State Park"
en_US.Garoupa verdadeira entre pedras. Foto: N: Actual Grouper between stones. Photo by: Nauther Andres
en_US.Graças à beleza do casco, as tartarugas-: Thanks to the beauty of their shells, Hawksbill turtles were hunted to near extinction. Its shell was used to make utensils such as jewelry boxes and objects such as combs, hence its popular name in Brazil "Comb turtle".
en_US.Há muitos lugares no mundo que afundam b: There are many places in the world that purposely sink ships (and even war tanks or planes). The structures are cleaned of their pollutants, such as oil and toxic materials, and deliberately sunk. There, resting on the seabed, they become an artificial reef: they serve as a structure for corals, a refuge for fish, and as a diving attraction.
en_US.Habitat: Ampla distribuição no hemisféri: Habitat: Ample distribution in the southern hemisphere in the Atlantic and Pacific oceans, Sub-Antarctic islands, Australia, New Zealand, and Africa.
en_US.Habitat: Pantropical, encontrado nos 3 o: Habitat: Pantropical, found in the 3 oceans, inhabit coastal and subtropical oceanic islands in Brazil up to Santa Catarina.
en_US.Hoje o Moréia está se desmantelando pela: Today, the Moreia is being dismantled by the powers of water and time. People are no longer allowed to embark it, but it remains at the bottom providing a beautiful spectacle for divers.
en_US.Inclui a Laje de Santos, os parcéis do B: It includes Laje de Santos, the Bandolim, Âncoras, Brilhante, do Sul, and Novo parcels, and the Rocks known as Calhaus, totaling 5,000 hectares of preserved area in the shape of a rectangle (10,000 by 5,000 m). Laje de Santos has a shape that resembles a whale, 550 m long, 33 m high and 185 m wide. The Brazilian Navy beacon is located at its highest point. It has practically no vegetation and is home to a large number of seabirds, which use the site as a breeding and resting area. Several species that inhabit the PEMLS are on the list of Brazilian fauna threatened with extinction. The Park is part of the route of several migratory species such as whales, dolphins, and seabirds. It is an important feeding area for several species, many of which are protected by international conventions, such as Bryde's whales, the aforementioned manta rays, sea turtles and others.
en_US.Laje de Santos em Realidade Virtual: Laje de Santos in Virtual Reality
en_US.Leia mais sobre o projeto \"A Laje em Re: Read more about the "Laje in Virtual Reality" project.
en_US.Leia um descritivo detalhado da tecnolog: Read a detailed write up of the technology used in the project.
en_US.Mas a internet permite chegarmos um pouc: But the internet allows us to get a bit closer.
en_US.Mergulhe virtualmente entre cardumes e r: Virtually dive between schools and coral reefs.
en_US.Mergulho em realidade virtual na Laje de: Virtual reality dive at Laje de Santos
en_US.Moréia verde, como é conhecida pelos mer: The green moray, as it is known to divers, is the most popular of all species. It is considered the largest in size, measuring more than 2 meters. Could it be part of the origin of the giant sea serpent legends?
en_US.Moréia, O primeiro naufrágio induzido pa: Moreia, The first induced shipwreck for diving in Brazil.
en_US.Na Laje de Santos elas aparecem em deter: At Laje de Santos they appear at certain times of the year and are usually pregnant, as displayed in the photo. Rays' pregnancy is noticeable through the belly and back, leaving them bulging on both sides. Photos by: Nauther Andres.
en_US.Na laje você sempre vê cardumes de salem: At Laje, you always see schools of salemas.
en_US.Nidificam na Laje de Santos cerca de 500: About 500 types nest in Laje de Santos, generating from one to three fingerlings per spawn, but not all of them always survive. It is a species that is very sensitive to human presence and therefore considered vulnerable to extinction according to the Threatened Animals Red List. A curiosity about this species: the association between the period of this occurrence coincides with the same period of occurrence of manta rays in the marine park.
en_US.O curioso dos budiões é que são responsá: The curious thing about the parrotfish is that they are responsible for a good part of the production of sand from the underwater soil (and therefore from the beaches!). They feed on corals and calcareous algae that are crushed and deposited on the sea floor. Some researchers estimate that one fish is capable of producing about a hundred kilos of sand per year! In this way, it helps to maintain the reefs, contributing to their preservation.
en_US.O interessante é que ao se deparar com u: The interesting thing is that when faced with a possible predator, it opens its fins in a fan shape that resemble a pair of wings, hence the Brazilian nickname of "False Flyer". This behavior of spreading its "wings" serves to deceive its predator, as it makes it look bigger than it really is.
en_US.O Moréia foi naufragado em 1992, e por m: The Moreia was wrecked in 1992, and for a long time almost nobody knew who was responsible for the wreck. The story only became public when the documentary Laje dos Sonhos was recorded, in which the author, Clóvis Benno de Carvalho, describes how it all happened. He found a boat hull and towed it to the island. He thought the plunge would be almost immediate, but it took hours for the boat to sink. He narrates the story himself:
en_US.O Parque Estadual Marinho da Laje de San: The Parque Estadual Marinho da Laje de Santos "Laje de Santos Marine State Park"

The Parque Estadual Marinho da Laje de Santos (PEMLS) "Laje de Santos Marine State Park" is the first Marine Park among the Conservation Units of the State of São Paulo, created on September 27, 1993, through State Decree No. 37.537. Its objective is to protect marine biodiversity and conserve biological diversity on the coast of the State of São Paulo. It is about 40km from the coast of the city of Santos.

The Laje de Santos Marine State Park is a protected area for marine and avian biodiversity. It is the only marine park in the state of São Paulo, and provides an environment conducive to the concentration of passing fish and reefs with great biological diversity.
en_US.O Parque pode ser visitado por meio de b: The Park can be visited by boat, but docking on the island is not allowed. It is about 22 nautical miles from Barra de São Vicente (40km). The navigation is long, about 1:30-2:00 hours in speedboats or 6:00-8:00 hours in slow boats, which makes the visit difficult and costly, being basically restricted to accredited scuba divers. With that, few people have access to a place of enormous beauty and fauna diversity.
en_US.O peixe anjo real, ou ciliaris, pode ser: The queen angelfish, or ciliaris, can be commonly found in coral reefs, slabs, and rocky bottoms in warm waters of the western portion of the Atlantic. In its natural habitat it feeds on corals, sponges, anemones, algae, crustaceans, and worms.
en_US.O peixe Coió ou falso-voador é um peixe: The Flying Gurnard or "False Flyer" fish is an unusual fish with morphological characteristics different from most fish we know. Its skull is rectangular with large eye sockets and a muzzle. More than that, he has two modified and extended pectoral fins almost the same size as his body and with webs between his spines.
en_US.O peixe que anda sobre os recifes! As Ma: The fish that walks on the reefs! The Molly Miller fish, as they are known, are small fish up to 8.5 cm in length that live in crevices and tiny crevices holes in the rocky shore and coral reefs. They are herbivores, feeding on seaweed and organic matter. They are like reef gardners.
en_US.O projeto estava previsto para 2020, com: The project was scheduled for 2020, with the first dives scheduled for March. Then the pandemic occurred. We had to pause diving activities and focus solely on technology development.
en_US.Os Atobás são aves marinhas pertencentes: The boobies are marine birds belonging to the Sulidae family, distributed in tropical and subtropical seas. In Brazil, 5 different species were registered. Present in large quantities with an estimated population of more than 2,000 birds, Laje de Santos is considered to be the largest nest of Brown boobies in Latin America.
en_US.Outra característica bem marcante é as b: Another very striking feature is the edges of their fins when open. They have a bright neon blue color that serves as a warning, often associated as a sign of danger to possible predators. This species has the behavior of foraging on the seabed, usually in sand, looking for small crustaceans and other organisms to feed on.
en_US.Outra curiosidade que chama a atenção pa: Another curiosity that draws attention to this kind of daytime habit is that during the night they need to rest and protect themselves from predators that roam around corals such as sharks. That's why they hide in the reefs' crevices and openings, but this hiding place doesn't always protect them, so the parrotfish secrete a smelly mucus that completely envelops their body like a transparent nightgown, inhibiting and confusing their predators.
en_US.Para respirar, elas abrem e fecham a boc: To breathe, they open and close their mouths constantly inhaling and exhaling water, trapping the oxygen in their gills and transporting it to the bloodstream. They are found in New Jersey, throughout the Caribbean, and within the entire Brazilian coast.
en_US.Parque criado pelo decreto estadual n° 3: Park created by state decree No. 37,537. Turning it into a preservation área where fishing is prohibited.
en_US.Parte do projeto deste site é recriar o: Part of this site's project is to recreate Moreia in 3D so that everyone, divers or not, can see a little more of it. And also to preserve it. It's a small, simple boat that has become part of the history of Brazilian diving, and who's been beaten up by age. As we write this, the Moreia is about to complete 30 years underwater, which is a considerable amount of time. Even though it is very close to the island, Laje de Santos sometimes presents strong currents and storms. Reports are that storm surges have already moved the shipwreck several times - it seems that its initial position was not even its current one, but lying down.
en_US.Paru, peixe-frade ou peixe-anjo: são mui: Paru, angelfish, or french angelfish: there are many names for the same species. It depends on which region you spotted it. It is one of the most distinguished and charismatic fish.
en_US.passam pela Laje. Chegam a 8 metros de e: pass through the Laje. They reach up to 8 meters in wingspan and 2 tons in weight. They are vulnerable to extinction.
en_US.Peixe Coió ou falso-voador: The Flying Gurnard or "False Flyer" fish
en_US.Pesquisa e texto: Nauther Andres. Revisã: Research and content: Nauther Andres. Reviewed by: Bruno Barberi Gnecco.
en_US.Pirá em tupi-guarani significa “peixe”:: Pirá "sand tilefish" in the Tupi-Guarani language means “fish”: the coolest thing is that this fish is actually popularly known as Pirá.
en_US.Podem ser encontradas nas zonas tropicai: They can be found in tropical and subtropical areas of the planet. At Laje de Santos they appear in the winter period, from April to September. The mantas are identified (photo ID) individually by the ventral spots that form unique patterns. These photographs are then entered into national and international databases, thus making it possible to obtain a population estimate and serve as a basis for verification in the case of future spotings.
en_US.Pontos de Mergulho na Laje de Santos: Diving Spots at Laje de Santos
en_US.Por não haver outras formações rochosas: As there are no other nearby rock formations or islands, it has a large concentration of reefs and fish passing through, making it one of the main diving and underwater photography spots in the country. The Park also has a wrecked boat.
en_US.Possui comportamento mais agressivo e há: It has a more aggressive behavior and nocturnal habits, it is an outstanding predator, it ambushes its prey by remaining in its lair and pops out to feed on fish, crustaceans, and molluscs, its favorite food. With very sharp teeth, its bite can cause serious injury to humans, so it is recommended not to get too close.
en_US.Possui hábito diurno e por isso não é di: It has a daytime habit and therefore it is not difficult to be found during diving activities. It does not pose any risk to humans and is commonly found on the seabed in search of small crustaceans and worms. Today, its biggest threat is its capture for the aquarium ornamental fish market. It is found in tropical and subtropical areas of the Atlantic Ocean.
en_US.Possui várias características únicas: En: It possesses several unique characteristics: Found all over the Brazilian coast, it is a reef fish with a docile behavior, commonly seen during dives and are tremendously photogenic. Some experts suggest that they are monogamous, mating for life. It's common to see them in pairs.
en_US.Primeiros mergulhos na Laje de Santos: First dives in Laje de Santos
en_US.Produzido o documentário Laje dos Sonhos: The documentary Laje dos Sonhos was produced.
en_US.Projeto de mapear a Laje de Santos em re: Project for mapping Laje de Santos in virtual reality
en_US.Publicado o livro \"Laje de Santos, Laje: The book "Laje de Santos, Laje dos Sonhos" was published.
en_US.Quando ameaçado, nada ligeiramente para: When threatened, it quickly swims into its gravel pile to protect itself and only comes out again when it feels safe.
en_US.Quando saem de suas tocas, em busca de a: When they leave their burrows in search of food during low tide, they lean on their pectoral fins and crawl as if they were walking from one point to another, foraging the shore along the exposed algae on the rocks, and at the slightest sign of danger they jump into the water and burrow in again.
en_US.Raias-borboleta.\n Pode: Butterfly rays. It can be quite difficult to differentiate the male from the female, but an important detail about cartilaginous fish, or rays and sharks, is that males have two claspers (or penises) which can be seen at the base of the tail in males and are absent in females, as you can see in the photos. Photos by: Nauther Andres
en_US.Reconhecida como a maior espécie de raia: Recognized as the largest ray species in the world, which can exceed 8 meters in span from one fin to the other and weigh more than 2,000 kilos, the manta ray does not have a stinger. It is the fish with the biggest brain compared to all the other fish in the sea, so it is extremely intelligent, a very sweet and curious animal. When it meets a diver, it allows for interaction and sometimes spends several minutes swimming around him to find out what it is. The divers' air bubbles seem to tickle its belly!
en_US.São animais de reprodução lenta com perí: They are slow-breeding animals with a gestational period of 10 to 14 months, generating only one offspring every 3 to 4 years. They are threatened with extinction due to intentional and accidental fishing carried out all over the world, this species has no commercial value for human consumption, but there is an interest in the Asian market for its by-products such as its gills.
en_US.São aves que mergulham para capturar sua: They are birds that dive to capture their prey when they see shoals, mainly sardines and anchovies.
en_US.São facilmente identificadas e conhecida: They are easily identified and popularly known as salemas. Their behavior of always being in schools and not showing fear allows them to be contemplated and photographed a lot by divers, providing incredible images with a spectacular color contrast composed by the environment in which they live.
en_US.São peixes de cores deslumbrantes e muit: They are fish with very dazzling and vivid colors that glow similar to neon. They are usually found in pairs, and in the presence of divers they are somewhat skittish; they feel threatened and seek to hide in crevices. Like the angelfish, the ciliaris has no commercial value, except fot the aquarium fish market, presenting a great threat to the species as it is heavily caught in its habitat.
en_US.São peixes muito apreciados pela culinár: These fish are very sought out for cuisine due to their firm and white meat. Because of this, they are extremely exploited for trade; today, their population is declining, being categorized as Vulnerable to extinction according to the IUCN. The Laje de Santos Marine State Park is one of its last refuges, where you can find specimens of considerable size with an average weight between 20 to 30 kilos.
en_US.Se alimenta de pequenos peixes, lulas e: It feeds on small fish, squid, and crustaceans. It is one of the birds that dive to capture its food. Its name indicates their behavior of always being in flocks in the areas where the species occurs.
en_US.Se estiver procurando espécies, veja a l: If you're searching for species, see the full list.
en_US.Seu estado de conservação é de menor pre: Its population status is of lesser concern on the Threatened Species Red List, being found in large quantities in all oceans, highly appreciated by divers, with the biggest threat being the aquariums' ornamental fish market.
en_US.Seu nado se dá de forma semelhante ao ra: Its swimming fashion is smilar to a snake's crawl, propelling its body back and forth. They are commonly found on the seabed, in burrows and crevices, in rocks and coral reefs. They are strong predators and feed on other fish, crustaceans, and molluscs. They have very sharp teeth and a very powerful bite.
en_US.Seu nome é de origem Árabe - Abu signifi: Its name is of Arabic origin - Abu means father or leader of the reefs. It is the male who takes care of the fingerlings. They are found in all tropical and subtropical oceans. Known here in Brazil by the popular name of sargentinho "tiny sergeant", perhaps for presenting a very characteristic behavior of protecting its eggs in the rocks. If any other animal gets close it will attack fiercely regardless of the size of the threat, including curious divers who get too close.
en_US.Seus filhotes são bem diferentes quando: Their offspring are very different when they are juveniles, showing continuous yellow stripes on their body disk that turn into yellowish spots when they move into adulthood. This species is not of interest for fishing, but it has great value in the ornamental fish market or for aquarium enthusiasts, being widely commercialized to compose aquarium environments around the world.

en_US.Sobre o projeto Laje de Santos Virtual: About the Virtual Laje de Santos project
en_US.Sobre seres vivos na Laje de Santos: About living beings at Laje de Santos
en_US.Sua maior ameaça é a pesca esportiva e p: Its biggest threat is sport and predatory fishing, despite not presenting commercial interest, it is a very popular fish in restaurants around the world and large aquariums.
en_US.Trinta-réis-de-bando é uma ave de pequen: The Band tern is a small bird, it has a white coat, black tuft and legs, and a yellow beak. Its nests can be seen from Espírito Santo to Santa Catarina. In São Paulo, it can be found at the Archipelago de Alcatrazes, Laje de Santos, beaches, and estuaries.
en_US.Um comportamento observado na espécie,: A behavior observed in the species, while diving in Laje de Santos, is the dispute with other types for its territory, expelling the invader from its burrow with attacks and even bites. It is possible to notice an interchangeable color pattern according to the substrate it is on... if it is rocky, the spot patterns will be vivid as if they were a camouflage, when in a light, sandy environment, its body pales to the color of sand, mimicking itself with the environment.
en_US.Um mapa interativo para conhecer os pont: An interactive map to discover the diving spots available at Laje
en_US.Um mergulhador fotografa duas raias mant: A diver photographs two manta rays at Laje de Santos. Photo by: Nauther Andres
en_US.Uma das aves marinhas mais comuns e conh: One of the most common seabirds, well-known to beachgoers and coastal strips around the world. The gull or seagull, despite being a seabird, is considered a synanthropic bird, that is, birds that live or share common environments with humans. They feed on fish leftovers and carcasses, are furtive and are always on the lookout for an opportunity for easy food.
en_US.Uma das práticas que o mergulho permite: One common diving practice is visiting shipwrecks. While many are tragedies, this is not the case of the Moreia, our beloved shipwreck at Laje de Santos.

en_US.Veja no seu computador cardumes de peixe: Check out schools of fish, the Moreia shipwreck, and fantastic animals on your computer, just as if you were there. Experience what it's like to dive at Laje de Santos right now.
en_US.Vivemos em um planeta de pequenas maravi: We live in a plant of natural wonders. Giant forests, beautiful waterfalls, remote islands.
